dialogue.speaker: Dilbert
dialogue.text: I'M GRUMPY TODAY, SO DON'T EVEN TRY TO TALK TO ME.

dialogue.speaker: Dogbert
dialogue.text: AND DON'T TRY TO FLATTER ME OR GIVE ME CHOCOLATE CAKE TO MAKE ME FEEL BETTER.

dialogue.speaker: Dilbert
dialogue.text: AND I GUESS I SHOULDN'T SCRATCH YOU BEHIND THE EARS UNTIL YOU HAVE LITTLE LEG SPASMS.

dialogue.speaker: Dogbert
dialogue.text: RIGHT. NONE OF THAT.

dialogue.speaker: Dogbert
dialogue.text: I'M STARTING TO WRITE AN UNAUTHORIZED BIOGRAPHY ABOUT YOU.

dialogue.speaker: Dogbert
dialogue.text: IT'S KIND OF A "PET AND TELL" EXPOSÉ FULL OF STARTLING REVELATIONS.

dialogue.speaker: Dilbert
dialogue.text: who would be startled by MY LIFE ?

dialogue.speaker: Dogbert
dialogue.text: I THINK YOU WILL BE.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: ARE YOU REALLY GOING THROUGH WITH THE UNAUTHORIZED BIOGRAPHY OF ME?

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: YES.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: I'M UP TO THE PART WHERE JACKIE 'O' AND LIZ TAYLOR FIGHT A DUEL FOR YOUR LOVE.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: TRAGICALLY, NEITHER ARE AWARE THAT YOU'RE CARRYING STEVE GARVEY'S BABY!

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: TAP TAP TAP

dialogue.speaker: BACKGROUND CHARACTER
dialogue.text: WELCOME TO ANOTHER MEETING OF THE "SKEPTICS SOCIETY."

dialogue.speaker: BACKGROUND CHARACTER
dialogue.text: TONIGHT WE WILL USE SCIENTIFIC METHODS TO DEBUNK EDNA GRIFFIN'S CLAIM THAT SHE CAN TURN AN AUDIENCE INTO A FLOCK OF CHICKENS. ... WE'LL NEED SOME VOLUNTEERS ...

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: MOTION TO ADJOURN...

dialogue.speaker: BACKGROUND CHARACTER
dialogue.text: WHOA, LOOK AT THE TIME!

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: GOOD NEWS: THE "ALL-YOU-CAN-EAT" SALAD BAR JOINT JUST DECIDED TO STAY OPEN TWENTY-FOUR HOURS A DAY!

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: WE CAN GET A TABLE BY THE WINDOW AND LIVE THERE FOR THE REST OF OUR LIVES—FOR ONLY $5.95 A PIECE!

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: HOW WOULD WE BATHE?

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: THEY HAVE LITTLE "MOIST" TOWELETTES.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: DO YOU HAVE SOMETHING FOR A HEADACHE?

dialogue.speaker: BACKGROUND CHARACTER
dialogue.text: I'M PRETTY SURE THIS WILL DO THE TRICK.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: I WONDER IF HE MEANT SOMETHING TO GET _RID_ OF A HEADACHE.

dialogue.speaker: BACKGROUND CHARACTER
dialogue.text: NAH...

dialogue.speaker: BACKGROUND CHARACTER
dialogue.text: THANKS.

dialogue.speaker: CharacterName
dialogue.text: ...AND YOU'RE QUITE CERTAIN THESE WILL SHRINK TO FIT?

dialogue.speaker: BACKGROUND CHARACTER
dialogue.text: YOU HAVE MY WORD AS A RETAIL SALES- MAN.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: YOU WERE TAKEN.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: NO, THEY SHRINK IN THE WASH.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: LIKE A GLOVE...

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: LIKE A GLOVE WITH TWO FINGERS.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: I'VE GOT TO GET OUT OF THIS BAD MOOD SOMEHOW.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: I'LL HAVE TO FIND SOMEBODY INNOCENT TO BLAME ...

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: AND MAKE HIM PLEAD FOR MY FORGIVENESS.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: HI, DOGBERT.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: IS THAT SOME KIND OF AN INSULT ?

dialogue.speaker: DOBGERT
dialogue.text: I CAN FEEL THE STATIC ELECTRICITY BUILDING...

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: THOR DOG OF THUNDER... I MUST CERTAINLY WILL NOT CALL YOU. PREPARE TO DIE.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: MAYBE SINCE YOU'RE FULL OF STATIC ELECTRICITY, YOU SHOULD SAY “IT IS USELSS TO BE A RESISTOR.” HEE-HEE-HEE.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: ZAP!!

dialogue.speaker: BACKGROUND CHARACTER
dialogue.text: NOTHING ANNOYS THE “DOG OF THUNDER” QUITE AS MUCH AS NERD PUNNS.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: LET'S GO... IT'S TIME TO RENEW YOUR DOG LICENSE.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: I WONDER WHAT HAPPENS IF I FAIL THE WRITTEN TEST?

dialogue.speaker: Dilbert
dialogue.text: I'M SORRY, BUT IT SEEMS YOU'VE FAILED THE WRITTEN PORTION OF THE DOG LICENSE TEST.

dialogue.speaker: Dogbert
dialogue.text: IMPOSSIBLE!

dialogue.speaker: Dilbert
dialogue.text: FOR EXAMPLE, THIS QUESTION ON 'NATURAL ENEMIES': THE CORRECT ANSWER IS 'MAILMAN.' YOU WROTE- IN 'FAX MACHINE.'

dialogue.speaker: Dilbert
dialogue.text: HOW'D IT GO?

dialogue.speaker: Dogbert
dialogue.text: THE 'DEPARTMENT OF DOGS' DOES NOT KEEP UP WITH EMERGING TRENDS.

dialogue.speaker: Dilbert
dialogue.text: I THINK IT'S MY FUEL PUMP.

dialogue.speaker: Dogbert
dialogue.text: YOUR WHAT?

dialogue.speaker: Dilbert
dialogue.text: WHAT I MEAN IS I THINK IT'S MY @*!#★ FUEL PUMP.

dialogue.speaker: Dogbert
dialogue.text: WELL, WHY DIDN'T YOU JUST #$*@ SAY SO?

dialogue.speaker: Dilbert
dialogue.text: SORRY... I FORGOT WHERE I WAS.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: YOU KNOW, MANY GREAT MEN KEPT DIARIES.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: NOT TO MENTION THE ENTIRE KIRK CAMERON FAN CLUB

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: Monday: woke up. Went to work. Came home. Ate. Watched T.V. and went to bed

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: WELL, THIS WAS BOTH THERAPEUTIC AND SATISFYING.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: SOMETIMES IT'S GOOD TO BARE YOUR SOUL LIKE THAT

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: Who the heck is Kirk Cameron?

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: Tuesday: See 'Monday.'

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: YOU WHAT??!

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: I GOT A JOB AS A SUBSTITUTE SCHOOL TEACHER.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: YOU AREN'T QUALIFIED TO BE A TEACHER. YOU'RE A DOG.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: LITTLE KIDS WON'T KNOW THE DIFFERENCE.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: YOU DO REMIND ME A BIT OF MY FOURTH GRADE TEACHER.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: JUST A COINCIDENCE?

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: CAN'T I TALK YOU OUT OF BECOMING A SUB-SITITUTE TEACHER?

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: DON'T WORRY.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: I WON'T DAMAGE THE LITTLE TYKES.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: GOOD MORNING, CHILDREN. I'M MR. DOGBERT.

dialogue.speaker: Background Character
dialogue.text: ARE YOU FLAMMABLE?

dialogue.speaker: Jennifer
dialogue.text: JENNIFER! PUT THAT FLAME-THROWER AWAY RIGHT THIS MINUTE!

dialogue.speaker: Dobert
dialogue.text: EUGENE! RELEASE THOSE HOSTAGES OR I SHALL BE FORCED TO FLY THIS CHALK ERASER AT YOUR HEAD!

dialogue.speaker: Dobert
dialogue.text: IS THAT A "STINGER" MISSILE LAUNCHER? WELL, I HOPE YOU BROUGHT ENOUGH FOR EVERYBODY!

dialogue.speaker: Dobert
dialogue.text: I DID.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: OKAY, CLASS ... PUT YOUR WEAPONS AWAY AND OPEN YOUR TV GUIDES.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: TIMMY, PLEASE READ ALOUD THE PASSAGE FROM 'FALCON CREST' UNDER THE FRIDAY LISTINGS.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: THERE'S GOT TO BE A BETTER WAY TO TEACH SEX EDUCATION.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: HOW WAS YOUR FIRST DAY AS A SUBSTITUTE SCHOOL TEACHER?

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: IMAGINE FEELING COMPLETELY POWER-LESS ... LIKE A MARBLE STATUE ...

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: GOSH... THAT SOUNDS PRETTY BAD.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: NOW IMAGINE THE BIGGEST FLOCK OF PIGEONS YOU EVER SAW...

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: I THINK I'M LOSING MY HAIR.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: DON'T BE SILLY. YOU AREN'T LOSING YOUR HAIR.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: I'M NOT? OH, GOOD.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: HOW COULD YOU POSSIBLY LOSE THESE HUGE CLUMPS...

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: HI. I'M FROM THE ORGANIZATION FOR THE PROTECTION OF UGLY PEOPLE.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: WE ARE DEDICATED TO ELIMINATING THE STEREOTYPE OF UGLY PEOPLE AS 'SMART' AND 'NICE.'

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: OKAY, I'LL MAKE A DONATION.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: THANKS, BUT THIS IS A MEMBERSHIP DRIVE...

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: I'M NEVER GOING TO ANSWER THE DOOR AGAIN.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: DIDN'T HE RECOGNIZE YOU AS HIS GOD?

dialogue.speaker: Dilbert
dialogue.text: ...AND WOMEN HAVE ALWAYS PLAYED HARD TO GET...

dialogue.speaker: Dilbert
dialogue.text: THEN HOW ABOUT A DATE NEXT YEAR?

dialogue.speaker: Eve
dialogue.text: I'D LOVE TO, BUT I DON'T HAVE A THING TO WEAR.

dialogue.speaker: Doctor
dialogue.text: NORMALLY I'D GIVE YOU SIX MONTHS TO LIVE

dialogue.speaker: Doctor
dialogue.text: BUT WE'RE HAVING A "50% OFF SALE" TODAY, SO I'LL GIVE YOU A FULL YEAR FOR THE SAME PRICE

dialogue.speaker: Doctor
dialogue.text: AND YOU GET AN EXTRA TEN DAYS IF YOU PAY CASH!

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: ... AND THE DOCTOR GIVE ME JUST A YEAR TO LIVE.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: I'M SORRY, LITTLE GUY... I DON'T KNOW HOW YOU'LL MANAGE WITHOUT ME.

dialogue.speaker: DOBERT
dialogue.text: WOULD IT BE TOO MUCH TROUBLE TO PAINT THE HOUSE BEFORE YOU GO?

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text:
IT SEEMS WE HAD A MIX-UP WITH YOUR TEST RESULTS.
THEN I'M NOT DYING?

dialogue.speaker: BACKGROUND CHARACTER
dialogue.text:
WE DOCTORS ARE AMAZINGLY SMART,
BUT OCCASIONALLY WE MAKE A LITTLE ERROR.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: WELL... I UNDERSTAND.

dialogue.speaker: BACKGROUND CHARACTER
dialogue.text: BY THE WAY, YOUR PAP SMEAR WAS NORMAL.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: BY MY CALCULATIONS, WE CAN MAKE MILLIONS BY COMBINING A MORTUARY BUSINESS AND A GARBAGE COLLECTION BUSINESS.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: OUR CUSTOMERS COULD SIMPLY LEAVE THE DEARLY DEPARTED BY THE CURB FOR PICK-UP.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: LET'S NOT PUSH A GOOD IDEA TOO FAR.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: MAYBE WE COULD ADD PIZZA DELIVERY, TOO.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: LET'S NOT PUSH A GOOD IDEA TOO FAR.

dialogue.speaker: Dilbert
dialogue.text: I HATE FANCY HOTELS LIKE THIS....

dialogue.speaker: Dilbert
dialogue.text: AM I EXPECTED TO TIP THE MAID WHEN I LEAVE ?

dialogue.speaker: Dilbert
dialogue.text: I COULD ASK THAT CONCIERGE GUY...

dialogue.speaker: Dilbert
dialogue.text: CAN I TRUST A GUY WITH A FRENCH-SOUNDING JOB?

dialogue.speaker: Dilbert
dialogue.text: ...AND DO I HAVE TO TIP HIM?

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: HA HA HA! MY SCHEME TO CONQUER EARTH IS RIGHT ON TRACK!

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: I'VE BEEN APPROVED FOR A MACY'S CREDIT CARD!

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: I'LL USE THIS CREDIT HISTORY TO APPLY FOR VISA AND MASTERCARD.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: SOON I'LL HAVE CREDIT CARDS FROM EVERY BANK IN THE WORLD.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: THEN I'LL DO A CASH ADVANCE ON EVERY CARD, NETTING BILLIONS TO FORM A WORLD-WIDE LOTTERY PRIZE.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: AND EVERYBODY WHO SUPPORTS ME AS SUPREME RULER OF EARTH GETS ONE FREE LOTTERY TICKET.

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: YOU KNOW, MOST DOGS WOULD BE DELIGHTED JUST TO GET A NICE CHEW-TOY.

dialogue.speaker: Dilbert
dialogue.text: I'VE DECIDED TO WRITE DOWN ALL OF THE SO-CALLED "UNWRITTEN RULES."

dialogue.speaker: Dogbert
dialogue.text: SO FAR I HAVE "DON'T PHONE AFTER TEN P.M." AND ... UH ...

dialogue.speaker: Dogbert
dialogue.text: "DON'T THROW PORCUPInes IN A BALLoon STOrE" ?

dialogue.speaker: Dilbert
dialogue.text: THAT'S IT?

dialogue.speaker: Dogbert
dialogue.text: HOW ABOUT "DON'T THROW PORCUPInes IN A BALLoon STOrE" ?

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: WHILE YOU WERE WASTING YOUR TIME AT WORK I CAME UP WITH A MILLION DOLLAR IDEA.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: IT'S THE "MADONNA SUN TAN LOTION APPLICATOR" FOR LONELY GUYS!!

dialogue.speaker: DILBERT
dialogue.text: I'LL TAKE ONE.

dialogue.speaker: DOGBERT
dialogue.text: IT LOOKS LIKE BARBIE ON A STICK, BUT IT'S MADONNA.
